video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg5.mp4
question: how do you program a transmitter that was previously linked?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.139 --> 00:00:04.420
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.420 --> 00:00:08.054
Programming your HomeLink system
is simple, let me show you how.
00:00:08.054 --> 00:00:10.470
First, turn on your car.
00:00:10.470 --> 00:00:13.491
Hold your old transmitter a couple of
inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.

inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.

you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.

00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.

question: How do you program additional buttons?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:01:20.190 --> 00:01:23.630
Keep in mind, if your transmitter stops
working which you're programming,
00:01:23.630 --> 00:01:25.890
you'll have to hold the function
button while you press and
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380
release the transmitter every two seconds.
00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950
You'll see the indicator
light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590
then faster once the signal has
been sent and accepted again.
00:01:34.590 --> 00:01:35.175
Still with me?

video_trans:
00:01:20.190 --> 00:01:23.630
Keep in mind, if your transmitter stops
working which you're programming,
00:01:23.630 --> 00:01:25.890
you'll have to hold the function
button while you press and
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:28.380
release the transmitter every two seconds.
00:01:28.380 --> 00:01:30.950
You'll see the indicator
light flash slowly at first
00:01:30.950 --> 00:01:34.590
then faster once the signal has
been sent and accepted again.
00:01:34.590 --> 00:01:35.175
Still with me?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4
question: how do you access the cup holders?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4
question: How do you access the cup holders?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:41.900
To access the other two cup holders and
storage bin, pull the middle seat back
00:00:41.900 --> 00:00:46.540
down by pushing the button on
the passenger side of the console, here.
00:00:46.540 --> 00:00:50.180
You can open the storage
bin by squeezing the small latch.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:54.160
For your added security, this storage bin
will only open when the seat is folded.
00:00:54.160 --> 00:00:57.783
So there's no worry of things falling
out when it's in the upright position.
00:00:57.783 --> 00:01:02.415
And keep in mind, because the cup holders
have small rubber pads on the inside,
00:01:02.415 --> 00:01:06.234
they can hold different size cups and
plastic bottles securely.

video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.

00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.

question: Where is the storage latch located?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:41.900
To access the other two cup holders and
storage bin, pull the middle seat back
00:00:41.900 --> 00:00:46.540
down by pushing the button on
the passenger side of the console, here.
00:00:46.540 --> 00:00:50.180
You can open the storage
bin by squeezing the small latch.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:54.160
For your added security, this storage bin
will only open when the seat is folded.
00:00:54.160 --> 00:00:57.783
So there's no worry of things falling
out when it's in the upright position.
00:00:57.783 --> 00:01:02.415
And keep in mind, because the cup holders
have small rubber pads on the inside,
00:01:02.415 --> 00:01:06.234
they can hold different size cups and
plastic bottles securely.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg3.mp4

00:01:02.415 --> 00:01:06.234
they can hold different size cups and
plastic bottles securely.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg3.mp4
question: How do I put the middle seat down to use the cup holder and storage tray?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:41.900
To access the other two cup holders and
storage bin, pull the middle seat back
00:00:41.900 --> 00:00:46.540
down by pushing the button on
the passenger side of the console, here.
00:00:46.540 --> 00:00:50.180
You can open the storage
bin by squeezing the small latch.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:54.160
For your added security, this storage bin
will only open when the seat is folded.
00:00:54.160 --> 00:00:57.783
So there's no worry of things falling
out when it's in the upright position.
00:00:57.783 --> 00:01:02.415
And keep in mind, because the cup holders
have small rubber pads on the inside,
00:01:02.415 --> 00:01:06.234
they can hold different size cups and
plastic bottles securely.

question: Where is the Launch Control made available?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4

question: How do you access rpm control?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.

question: What feature help the driver get smooth and consistent starts?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4

00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4
question: How do you turn on launch control?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:19.140
To turn it on, using the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:22.070
scroll down to Track Apps,
then Launch Control.
00:00:22.070 --> 00:00:24.232
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.232 --> 00:00:27.330
There, you'll see Launch Control and
RPM set.
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:29.290
The RPM feature allows you to set and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:35.030
hold a preferred RPM to launch at,
anywhere between 3,000 and 4,500 RPMs.
00:00:35.030 --> 00:00:38.410
To select your RPM,
use the up and down arrows.
00:00:38.410 --> 00:00:41.490
This helps you control the amount of
torque distributed to the rear wheels
00:00:41.490 --> 00:00:44.570
based on engine speed,
tire temperature and
00:00:44.570 --> 00:00:46.645
surface condition to
help prevent wheel spin.
00:00:46.645 --> 00:00:47.540
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg2.mp4
question: How do you select the RPM feature?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.

feature that is designed to help alert you
00:00:07.650 --> 00:00:11.825

vehicles approaching when backing

out of a parking space.

Let me explain.

question: What is the minimum speed required for the BLIS to activate?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.

question: How do i know the passing vehicle within my blind spot zone?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:46.465 --> 00:00:50.790
When a trailer is properly connected and
driving over five miles per hour, BLIS
00:00:50.790 --> 00:00:55.270
with trailer coverage uses sensors in the
vehicle's tail end to extend the detection
00:00:55.270 --> 00:00:59.300
area rearward from the vehicle's side
mirrors to the end of the trailer.

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4

system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be

00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: how to set up the blind spot detection on a trailer?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:22.695 --> 00:02:26.390
Cross-traffic alert warns you
of moving cars coming from
00:02:26.390 --> 00:02:30.490
either side when you're in reverse or
backing up and gives you three warnings.
00:02:30.490 --> 00:02:34.740
A light on the corresponding
side view mirror, a chime, and
00:02:34.740 --> 00:02:36.670
a message in your message center.

question: How many alerts does it send you?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.

video_trans:
00:00:17.860 --> 00:00:22.440
BLIS, or Blind Spot Information System,
is active anytime you put your vehicle in
00:00:22.440 --> 00:00:25.160
drive and are driving forward
above five miles per hour.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg2.mp4
question: When is BLIS activated when driving?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.

question: Does Blis warn you of oncoming vehicles?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.

video_trans:
00:00:46.465 --> 00:00:50.790
When a trailer is properly connected and
driving over five miles per hour, BLIS
00:00:50.790 --> 00:00:55.270
with trailer coverage uses sensors in the
vehicle's tail end to extend the detection
00:00:55.270 --> 00:00:59.300
area rearward from the vehicle's side
mirrors to the end of the trailer.

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: How does BLIS prepare you to tow a trailer?

00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.

use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.

question: How do I measure the length of my trailer to input into the BLIS blind spot detector to make sure I have adequately cover the entire blindspot caused by my trailer?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:22.695 --> 00:02:26.390
Cross-traffic alert warns you
of moving cars coming from
00:02:26.390 --> 00:02:30.490
either side when you're in reverse or
backing up and gives you three warnings.
00:02:30.490 --> 00:02:34.740
A light on the corresponding
side view mirror, a chime, and
00:02:34.740 --> 00:02:36.670
a message in your message center.

question: How do you get notified of cross traffic?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg7.mp4
question: Does the system alert me if there is a problem?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:02:36.670 --> 00:02:39.370
Keep in mind,
anytime a trailer is connected and
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.160
information is input, cross-traffic
alert automatically turns off.
00:02:44.260 --> 00:02:48.160
And finally, extreme weather
conditions could block the sensors, but
00:02:48.160 --> 00:02:52.450
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:02:52.450 --> 00:02:54.460
As with most radar, infrared and
00:02:54.460 --> 00:02:58.660
ultrasonic type sensing systems,
there is a possibility of false alerts.

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg2.mp4
question: How do you operate towload braking in Ford trucks?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg3.mp4

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg3.mp4
question: What is the use of the plus and minus gain adjust button

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:44.710
Still with me?
00:00:44.710 --> 00:00:46.930
Great, then let's move on.
00:00:46.930 --> 00:00:49.210
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970
you'll want to have the towing screen up
on your 8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180
scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.

question: How can we know how much power delivered to tailer brake?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg5.mp4

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg2.mp4
question: What stops the car's trailer?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:14.730 --> 00:00:17.840
The Trailer Brake Controller automatically
applies the trailer brakes when
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:20.160
the tow vehicle's brakes are pressed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg2.mp4
question: How does the trailer brake work?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:14.730 --> 00:00:17.840
The Trailer Brake Controller automatically
applies the trailer brakes when
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:20.160
the tow vehicle's brakes are pressed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg2.mp4
question: Does the trailer brake controller automatically apply the trailer brake?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg3.mp4

question: When can the slide controller be used?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:44.710
Still with me?
00:00:44.710 --> 00:00:46.930
Great, then let's move on.
00:00:46.930 --> 00:00:49.210
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970
you'll want to have the towing screen up
on your 8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180
scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg4.mp4

00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810
Then, you'll see the gain setting screen.
00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.

question: How do you see the current gain setting?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg5.mp4

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg1.mp4
question: Do all Ford trucks come equipped with an electronic trailer brake controller?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:15.680 --> 00:00:19.000
The trailer brake controller
automatically applies the trailer brakes
00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg2.mp4

00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg1.mp4
question: When should the trailer brake system be used?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:15.680 --> 00:00:19.000
The trailer brake controller
automatically applies the trailer brakes
00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg2.mp4
question: What is the purpose of the gain setting?

00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: How do I know if my trailer has been hooked up?

video_name: Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.784
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.784 --> 00:00:08.220
Is there any way to keep
my trailer from swaying?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.310
>> Is there any way to reduce
the sway from my trailer?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:16.510
>> For those of you who like to tow,
Ford has something that can help reduce
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:19.330
how much your trailer sways
while you are driving.
00:00:19.330 --> 00:00:20.180
Here's how it works.
00:00:20.180 --> 00:00:25.060
If your trailer starts to sway, you'll see
the stability control light flash, and
00:00:25.060 --> 00:00:29.150
a trailer sway reduce speed message
in your information display.
00:00:29.150 --> 00:00:32.380
The trailer sway controller feature
will begin to apply the brakes to
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:36.210
individual wheels, and
reduce your engine power if needed.
00:00:36.210 --> 00:00:39.800
If this happens, it's likely that
your trailer is improperly loaded, or
00:00:39.800 --> 00:00:42.620
the speed of your vehicle and
trailer are too high.
00:00:42.620 --> 00:00:45.960
Slow down, pull your vehicle off the road,
and make sure that
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:50.270
your trailer is connected correctly and
your load is distributed properly.
00:00:50.270 --> 00:00:53.250
Then drive at a slower speed than
you were before the sway occurred.
00:00:54.390 --> 00:00:56.300
And here's something
else you need to know.
00:00:56.300 --> 00:01:00.173
Trailer sway control will not affect how
your vehicle handles in normal driving
00:01:00.173 --> 00:01:02.725
conditions, or
when you're not towing a trailer.
00:01:02.725 --> 00:01:03.518
Any questions?
00:01:03.518 --> 00:01:04.904
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:14.904
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638_seg1.mp4
question: What are the features of Trailer sway control?

The trailer sway controller feature
will begin to apply the brakes to
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:36.210
individual wheels, and
reduce your engine power if needed.
00:00:36.210 --> 00:00:39.800
If this happens, it's likely that
your trailer is improperly loaded, or
00:00:39.800 --> 00:00:42.620
the speed of your vehicle and
trailer are too high.
00:00:42.620 --> 00:00:45.960
Slow down, pull your vehicle off the road,
and make sure that
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:50.270
your trailer is connected correctly and
your load is distributed properly.
00:00:50.270 --> 00:00:53.250
Then drive at a slower speed than
you were before the sway occurred.
00:00:54.390 --> 00:00:56.300
And here's something
else you need to know.
00:00:56.300 --> 00:01:00.173
Trailer sway control will not affect how
your vehicle handles in normal driving
00:01:00.173 --> 00:01:02.725
conditions, or
when you're not towing a trailer.

00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:14.904

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638_seg1.mp4
question: What do you do when your trailer sways?

video_name: Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.784
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.784 --> 00:00:08.220
Is there any way to keep
my trailer from swaying?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.310
>> Is there any way to reduce
the sway from my trailer?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:16.510
>> For those of you who like to tow,
Ford has something that can help reduce
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:19.330
how much your trailer sways
while you are driving.
00:00:19.330 --> 00:00:20.180
Here's how it works.
00:00:20.180 --> 00:00:25.060
If your trailer starts to sway, you'll see
the stability control light flash, and
00:00:25.060 --> 00:00:29.150
a trailer sway reduce speed message
in your information display.
00:00:29.150 --> 00:00:32.380
The trailer sway controller feature
will begin to apply the brakes to
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:36.210
individual wheels, and
reduce your engine power if needed.
00:00:36.210 --> 00:00:39.800
If this happens, it's likely that
your trailer is improperly loaded, or
00:00:39.800 --> 00:00:42.620
the speed of your vehicle and
trailer are too high.
00:00:42.620 --> 00:00:45.960
Slow down, pull your vehicle off the road,
and make sure that
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:50.270
your trailer is connected correctly and
your load is distributed properly.
00:00:50.270 --> 00:00:53.250
Then drive at a slower speed than
you were before the sway occurred.
00:00:54.390 --> 00:00:56.300
And here's something
else you need to know.
00:00:56.300 --> 00:01:00.173
Trailer sway control will not affect how
your vehicle handles in normal driving
00:01:00.173 --> 00:01:02.725
conditions, or
when you're not towing a trailer.
00:01:02.725 --> 00:01:03.518
Any questions?
00:01:03.518 --> 00:01:04.904
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:14.904
[MUSIC]

question: If it gets damaged, how much is it to fix ?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4

00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: what products should you avoid cleaning your vehicle with?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:54.600 --> 00:00:56.900
Keep in mind stones, rocks, and
00:00:56.900 --> 00:01:01.420
dirt can create tiny pits on your
chrome bumper resulting in rust spots.
00:01:01.420 --> 00:01:05.320
If you notice rust spots appearing on your
bumper use a chrome polish to help remove
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:09.710
the spots, maintain the luster, and
prevent the reoccurrence of new ones.

And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100

maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.

For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.

question: What cleaning products can I use on the chrome finishes?

the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:54.600 --> 00:00:56.900
Keep in mind stones, rocks, and
00:00:56.900 --> 00:01:01.420
dirt can create tiny pits on your
chrome bumper resulting in rust spots.
00:01:01.420 --> 00:01:05.320
If you notice rust spots appearing on your
bumper use a chrome polish to help remove
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:09.710
the spots, maintain the luster, and
prevent the reoccurrence of new ones.

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc_seg1.mp4
question: What is the difference between a standard safety belt and an inflatable rear safety belt?

00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.

they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.

Any questions?

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: What feature on this vehicle allows you to power devices?

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:36.640 --> 00:00:39.860
Aid mode uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer your vehicle
00:00:39.860 --> 00:00:41.220
towards your lane.
00:00:41.220 --> 00:00:43.560
You'll actually feel
the wheel move a little.
00:00:43.560 --> 00:00:46.124
The modes can work together, or alone, and
00:00:46.124 --> 00:00:49.465
both use a forward-facing
camera to detect lane drift.
00:00:49.465 --> 00:00:50.623
Still with me?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:50.623 --> 00:00:54.582
Great, let's take a closer look at
what you'll see from the driver seat.
00:00:54.582 --> 00:00:56.689
If you want to use this system press,
00:00:56.689 --> 00:01:00.600
the on/off switch at the end
of the left hand star.
00:01:00.600 --> 00:01:01.850
Depending on your model,
00:01:01.850 --> 00:01:04.640
you may have to turn it on every
time you turn on your car.
00:01:04.640 --> 00:01:07.359
In other models, the system will
recall the last remembered settings.
00:01:08.420 --> 00:01:10.490
If you started the vehicle using MyKey,
00:01:10.490 --> 00:01:14.090
the system will turn on automatically
with the alert mode selected.

00:00:56.689 --> 00:01:00.600
the on/off switch at the end
of the left hand star.
00:01:00.600 --> 00:01:01.850
Depending on your model,
00:01:01.850 --> 00:01:04.640
you may have to turn it on every
time you turn on your car.
00:01:04.640 --> 00:01:07.359
In other models, the system will
recall the last remembered settings.
00:01:08.420 --> 00:01:10.490
If you started the vehicle using MyKey,
00:01:10.490 --> 00:01:14.090
the system will turn on automatically
with the alert mode selected.

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:14.090 --> 00:01:18.120
When the system is on,
you'll see a car icon with lane markings.
00:01:18.120 --> 00:01:20.900
If the lines are gray,
you're either driving too slow for
00:01:20.900 --> 00:01:24.500
the system to work,
the road has poor lane markings, or
00:01:24.500 --> 00:01:27.020
the camera cannot see the markings
because of weather conditions.

question: What does the green lines mean?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.
00:02:09.290 --> 00:02:10.400
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg8.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4
question: what can be adjusted to change the strength of the vibration in message center?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:36.640 --> 00:00:39.860
Aid mode uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer your vehicle
00:00:39.860 --> 00:00:41.220
towards your lane.
00:00:41.220 --> 00:00:43.560
You'll actually feel
the wheel move a little.
00:00:43.560 --> 00:00:46.124
The modes can work together, or alone, and
00:00:46.124 --> 00:00:49.465
both use a forward-facing
camera to detect lane drift.
00:00:49.465 --> 00:00:50.623
Still with me?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:36.640 --> 00:00:39.860
Aid mode uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer your vehicle
00:00:39.860 --> 00:00:41.220
towards your lane.
00:00:41.220 --> 00:00:43.560
You'll actually feel
the wheel move a little.
00:00:43.560 --> 00:00:46.124
The modes can work together, or alone, and
00:00:46.124 --> 00:00:49.465
both use a forward-facing
camera to detect lane drift.
00:00:49.465 --> 00:00:50.623
Still with me?

question: where is this located on car

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:50.623 --> 00:00:54.582
Great, let's take a closer look at
what you'll see from the driver seat.
00:00:54.582 --> 00:00:56.689
If you want to use this system press,
00:00:56.689 --> 00:01:00.600
the on/off switch at the end
of the left hand star.
00:01:00.600 --> 00:01:01.850
Depending on your model,
00:01:01.850 --> 00:01:04.640
you may have to turn it on every
time you turn on your car.
00:01:04.640 --> 00:01:07.359
In other models, the system will
recall the last remembered settings.
00:01:08.420 --> 00:01:10.490
If you started the vehicle using MyKey,
00:01:10.490 --> 00:01:14.090
the system will turn on automatically
with the alert mode selected.

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:14.090 --> 00:01:18.120
When the system is on,
you'll see a car icon with lane markings.
00:01:18.120 --> 00:01:20.900
If the lines are gray,
you're either driving too slow for
00:01:20.900 --> 00:01:24.500
the system to work,
the road has poor lane markings, or
00:01:24.500 --> 00:01:27.020
the camera cannot see the markings
because of weather conditions.

question: What could gray lines indicate?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:14.090 --> 00:01:18.120
When the system is on,
you'll see a car icon with lane markings.
00:01:18.120 --> 00:01:20.900
If the lines are gray,
you're either driving too slow for
00:01:20.900 --> 00:01:24.500
the system to work,
the road has poor lane markings, or
00:01:24.500 --> 00:01:27.020
the camera cannot see the markings
because of weather conditions.

question: How will i know when its ready to use?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.
00:02:09.290 --> 00:02:10.400
Any questions?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.170
[MUSIC]

Did you know that you can unlock your
car and start it without using a key?

with your key fob in your pocket or

the ignition, and lock all of your doors.

Let me explain.

00:00:10.910 --> 00:00:15.460
purse, you can unlock the doors, start
the ignition, and lock all of your doors.
00:00:15.460 --> 00:00:17.060
Let me explain.

question: What does the button on the handle do?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:00:26.460 --> 00:00:29.570
To lock your doors, simply press
the sensor on the door handle for
00:00:29.570 --> 00:00:30.890
about a half a second.
00:00:30.890 --> 00:00:33.470
It'll have ridges or
a square sensor like this.
00:00:34.530 --> 00:00:36.300
When you hear them click,
you'll know they're locked.
00:00:37.450 --> 00:00:41.090
Or you can press the lock/unlock
button on the inside door panel
00:00:41.090 --> 00:00:44.280
before closing the door and
it will automatically lock.
